Articles.Content:
**NOTE: This mod is now part of the default package for [@danfarnsy](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/67183-danfarnsy/)'s [continuation of the original TAC Life Support](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/139589-0) that has been developed in [@TaranisElsu](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57742-taraniselsu/)'s absesnce.**  
**<font color="#b22222">As such, this retexture is now superfluous for such installations (<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> users beware) and SHOULD NOT be installed alongside</font> [@danfarnsy](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/67183-danfarnsy/)'s fork.**  
**<font color="#b22222">This thread and the Spacedock page will remain for pre-1.1 users.</font>**

Since the KSP 1.0 release, I've had a few people ask me to update these textures for [@TaranisElsu](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57742-taraniselsu/)'s ever-excellent [**TAC Life Support**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/40667). It was also suggested that I separate the release out of the main TAC thread.

In this v2.2 update:

- Textures converted to DDS with mipmaps (no more shimmer)
- Switched to a module manager config setup to ease maintenance
- Fixed recycler texture paths
- Added to <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>

**Download:**

- **SpaceDock:** [http://spacedock.info/mod/206/TMS%20TAC%20Retexture](http://spacedock.info/mod/206/TMS%20TAC%20Retexture)
- **<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>:** Search for *"TAC Life Support Retexture"* (originally added 06/06/15, re-added via Spacedock 21/02/2016)  
![ckan-indexed-100.png](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/master/GUI/assets/ckan-indexed-100.png)

**Notes:**

- Due to the dependency on TAC Life Support, this mod won't appear in the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> application for KSP installations that don't have a compatible TAC Life Support version.  Basically, TAC has to be updated for the newest KSP version before dependent mods will show.

**Requirements:**

- [TAC Life Support](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/40667)
- [Module Manager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219)

**Gallery:**

<iframe frameborder="0" height="550" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2021-05-19T18:31:41Z" title="05/19/2021 06:31  PM" data-short="3 yr">May 19, 2021</time> by Snark**
  
Link to defunct website removed by moderator
Those look amazing. I'm downloading it now and will let you know if there are any problems. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Downloading now! Looks brilliant.
Gorgeous!
Beautiful! They look like something out of the tech manual for the *Enterprise-B*.

One question. The good old texture replacement allowed to change directly texture, with this new method, I guess the game is charging in memory the standard texture AND the retexture, am I right? Cause in this case it's an increase of memory use and since I'm really short on free memory... ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)

Hi there. Yep, you can save a few MB by deleting the TAC originals. It's pretty small savings.

I had thought about packaging a BAT file to do it automatically...
Why not just copy over the original textures?

Actually it's really not a small save in space, especially when you run lots of mods. These textures seem very nice, but I'd like to delete the originals and digging through TAC folder doesn't seem appealing.

Honest question, if you're really *that* stressed for memory that you worry about 5-10mb of textures, why would you even be looking at re-texture mods? I've always considered visual enhancements to be for 64bit users, considering they are just eyecandy at the expense of system resources.

Has anyone had an issue with the MFT textures showing up?....the HexCans look fine but the MFT will only show the stock "TAC" texture. It may be an issue with another mod, just wondering if someone has come across it.

Also, thank you for the sweet textures TMS!
why does this mod put the new textures in a new folder instead of just writing over the old ones?
Yeah my textures aren't showing up anymore. I have no idea why or whatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s different.
Yep, something is not working right, the pathpatches config file seems to be ok though.

@TMS

Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!

> 
> Yep, something is not working right, the pathpatches config file seems to be ok though.

I had modular fuel tanks installed. Removing it fixed the problem for me.
Wooo.... I always delete the stock canisters from TAC because I also use the Universal Storage mod, but with this I will gladly use them again, this are gorgeous!, Thank you!
**[MOD - Updated thread prefix with the new** **** **[Flag / Texture]** **** **tag]**

These textures are really nifty, I have been using them since several months now.

Thanks TMS !
I've been pulling these textures out of old saves for ages now, nice to see them as a separate release and still getting love!
Great textures matey, Thankyou for making TAC look good, Its my favourite Life support mod ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
is there an alternate download link? cause kerbalstuff is down ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

[@TMS](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57134-tms/) 

Since this was hosted exclusively on KerbalStuff, which has recently shutdown, any chance to get this rehosted on its replacement site, [SpaceDock.info](http://spacedock.info/) ?

Re-uploaded to SpaceDock.

Older versions haven't been uploaded as I don't want to confuse CKAN with multiple versions with multiple install methods.
